titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Robert Dash Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 06:22

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The papers include correspondence, writings, journals, sketchbooks, workbooks, photographs, clippings and other papers, artwork, and audiovisual materials. Correspondence includes letters with many fellow poets, painters, and gardeners. Writings include typescripts and manuscripts by Dash and others. Journals and workbooks include writings, drawings, and other documents pertaining mainly to paintings and the evolution of the gardens at Dash's Long Island estate, Madoo. Artwork includes drawings, oil paintings, lithographs, and photographs by Dash, James Schuyler, and Joe Brainard.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Granary Books, Inc., on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund and the Alfred Z. Baker, Jr. Fund, 2011.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 35 (audiovisual material): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 36 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 37 (microscope slides) Restricted fragile material. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Robert Dash Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Robert Dash Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: Robert Dash
bioghist.p: Robert Dash (1931- ) is an American painter, writer, and gardener. Dash's Long Island estate and garden, Madoo, is incorporated as the nonprofit Madoo Conservancy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The papers include correspondence, writings, journals, sketchbooks, workbooks, photographs, clippings and other papers, artwork, and audiovisual materials. Correspondence includes letters with many fellow poets, painters, and gardeners. Writings include typescripts and manuscripts by Dash and others. Journals and workbooks include writings, drawings, and other documents pertaining mainly to paintings and the evolution of the gardens at Dash's Long Island estate, Madoo. Artwork includes drawings, oil paintings, lithographs, and photographs by Dash, James Schuyler, and Joe Brainard.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into eight series: I. Correspondence, circa 1950s-2000s. II. Writings, circa 1970s-2000s. III. Journals, 1954-2010. IV. Sketchbooks and workbooks, 1967-2004. V. Photographs, circa 1954-2004. VI. Clippings and other papers, circa 1960s-2008. VII. Artwork, 1960-1964, undated. VII. Audiovisual materials, 1996-1998.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Oranized into two subseries: garden and personal correspondence and literary and art correspondence. Each subseries is arranged alphabetically.

scopecontent.p: Signed by both poet and painter. 48 ½ x 48 inches.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Lithographs by Robert Dash, lines by James Schuyler. Lithography Venture, 1971. Edition of 130 copies with 65 copies in color and 65 copies in black and white. Printed by Yann Samson with Jean-Pierre Remind at Shorewood Atelier. Each lithograph signed by painter and poet. 31 12/ x 43 inches.
